summary: Peter Dinklage verrät Episodenlängen von “Game of Thrones”
title: Peter Dinklage verrät Episodenlängen von “Game of Thrones”
body:
Am 14. April startet die achte und damit letzte Staffel der Fantasy-Kultserie “Game of Thrones”. Schon länger ist bekannt, dass es in dieser Staffel weniger Episoden geben soll, die dafür aber in Spielfilmlänge ausgestrahlt werden. Nun hat “GoT”-Star Peter Dinklage auf Instagram offenbar die Länge der Episoden bekannt gegeben – und die dürfte Fans erfreuen. 

Der Darsteller von Tyrion Lannister veröffentlichte eine Liste von sechs Folgen, neben denen die Laufzeit vermerkt ist. Demnach dauern die ersten beiden Folgen 60 Minuten, vier weitere Episoden 80 Minuten. Dinklage postete die Episodenlängen zusammen mit dem Starttermin der Staffel. Dazu schrieb er: “Die Laufzeiten für jede der sechs Episoden in Game of Thrones, Staffel 8!” Zuvor hatte der französische Sender “OCS” die Dauer der Folgen auf Anfrage des Magazins “Premiere” veröffentlicht. Der Ursprungssender HBO hat bisher nicht bestätigt, ob die Angaben wirklich richtig sind.

Erst Mitte Januar ist der offizielle Trailer zum “Game of Thrones”-Finale veröffentlicht worden. Dieser trägt den Namen “Crypts of Winterfell”, zu Deutsch: “Die Gruften von Winterfell”. In diesem sind Jon Snow, Sansa Stark und Arya Stark zu sehen, wie sie in den Katakomben von Winterfell an den Statuen bereits verstorbener Figuren vorbeigehen, unter anderem an denen von Lyanna Stark, der Mutter Jon Snows, und Ned Stark, dem Oberhaupt der Familie. Schließlich trifft das Trio am Ende eines Ganges aufeinander – und das vor ihren eigenen Statuen! Dann geht die Fackel von Jon Snow aus, es wird dunkel und die Umgebung wird in Eis gehüllt. 

Ab 14. April wird die Erfolgsserie bei Sky zu sehen sein. In der Zwischenzeit könnt ihr einen Marathon mit den alten Folgen von “Game of Thrones” starten - ebenfalls bei Sky.

Bilder: ddp images/ Instagram @peterdinklage

summary: Top 10 US subscription video apps pulled in $1.3B last year, a 62% increase from 2017
title: Top 10 US subscription video apps pulled in $1.3B last year, a 62% increase from 2017
body:
Subscriptions are booming on the app stores, and particularly subscription video apps, thanks to the growing number of cord cutters who are choosing to stream their TV shows and movies instead of paying for cable or satellite. In the U.S., the top 10 subscription video apps by revenue pulled in $1.27 billion in 2018 across both the iOS App Store and Google Play, according to new data from Sensor Tower — that’s a 62 percent increase over the $781 million spent in 2017.

It’s also three times higher than what was spent in these apps back in 2016.

The top app, not surprisingly, was Netflix — which snagged the spot for the second year in a row. It earned an estimated $529 million in the U.S., the report found. However, Netflix won’t maintain the top spot in the rankings in 2019, as the company recently made a decision to keep more of its subscription revenue to itself.

Netflix in 2018 had dropped in-app subscription sign-ups in its Android app on Google Play, then did the same on the iOS App Store in December. That will decrease its in-app subscription revenues this year, though it won’t immediately go to zero because of revenues from existing subscribers.

The No. 2 top grossing app was YouTube, which is maybe more of a surprise to those who don’t realize that the app they use to watch free videos is making quite so much money through in-app purchases. But YouTube offers a couple of different types of in-app purchases, including subscriptions to its ad-free tier, YouTube Premium, as well as virtual currency to be used in Super Chat.

Sensor Tower says YouTube took in less than half as much revenue as Netflix at around $223 million, but it grew substantially in 2018 — up 114 percent from $104 million in 2017.

HBO NOW was the No. 3 top grossing app, even though its subscriber base declined. The app generated 12 percent less in 2018, at $166 million, down from $189 million. The reason, naturally, was that the app was without “Game of Thrones” to attract viewers. That doesn’t bode all that well for HBO’s future without “Thrones,” unless its spin-off becomes a hit.

Hulu and YouTube TV were the No. 4 and No. 5 apps, respectively. Hulu grew by 68 percent while YouTube TV jumped up a whopping 419 percent. CBS’s streaming app is doing decently, too, with 57 percent year-over-year growth in subscriber spending.

Much of that comes from streamers interest in the new “Star Trek” series. In fact, with the Season 2 premiere this month, CBS said its streaming service hit a new milestone across both subscription sign-ups and unique viewers in a weekend. While the network didn’t share exact numbers, it said the January 19 weekend, when the new season of “Star Trek: Discovery” aired, eclipsed 2017’s previous record from the series premiere by more than 72 percent, in terms of sign-ups.

Combined, 2018’s top 10 subscription streaming apps accounted for a sizable chunk — now 22 percent — of non-game app revenue on the app stores in the U.S. Their 62 percent revenue growth was also more than all the other non-game apps combined, which grew 56 percent year-over-year, the new report said.

Subscriptions — and not just for streaming apps — have become the new driver for non-game spending on the app stores, and that isn’t going to change anytime soon.

According to App Annie’s recent forecast for 2019, 10 minutes of every hour spent consuming media across TV and internet will come from streaming video on mobile. It estimates that total time in video streaming apps will increase 110 percent from 2016 to 2019, with consumer spend in entertainment apps rising by 520 percent over that same period. Most of those revenues will come from the growth in in-app subscriptions, the firm had said earlier.

Read more: https://techcrunch.com/2019/01/24/top-10-u-s-subscription-video-apps-pulled-in-1-3b-last-year-a-62-increase-from-2017/

The post Top 10 US subscription video apps pulled in $1.3B last year, a 62% increase from 2017 appeared first on Viral TV News.



from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/top-10-us-subscription-video-apps-pulled-in-1-3b-last-year-a-62-increase-from-2017/

The post Top 10 US subscription video apps pulled in $1.3B last year, a 62% increase from 2017 appeared first on Viral TV News.

summary: Game of Thrones'un Final Sezonunda Yayınlanacak Bölümlerin Süreleri Belli Oldu!
title: Game of Thrones'un Final Sezonunda Yayınlanacak Bölümlerin Süreleri Belli Oldu!
body:
Game of Thrones’un Final Sezonunda Yayınlanacak Bölümlerin Süreleri Belli Oldu!

Game of Thrones dizisinin sekizinci ve final sezonu bu sene HBO’da yerini alacak. Dizinin son sezonunun başlama tarihi 14 Nisan olarak belirlenmişti. Peki herkese kendini kanıtlamış bu dizinin son sezonu basit ve kısa bölümlerden mi oluşacaktı? Hayır. Game of Thrones’un final sezonunda yayınlanacak bölümlerin süreleri belli oldu!Hepinizin tahmin edeceği gibi diğer sezonlara nazaran daha uzun…

summary:
Tyrion and the Starks
I've read a lot of theories on Tyrion possibly betraying D*ny, but what surprises me is there aren't much...
body:
Tyrion and the Starks

I’ve read a lot of theories on Tyrion possibly betraying D*ny, but what surprises me is there aren’t much theories with Tyrion betraying the Starks. There’s quite a few hints to this and it starts in AGOT.

“Tyrion Lannister looked up from his books and shivered, though the library was snug and warm. Something about the howling of a wolf took him right out of his here and now and left him in a dark forest of the mind, running naked before the pack.”- AGOT Tyrion I

“The direwolves were with him. The boy stopped by the door wide-eyed, but the wolves came on. Their eyes found Lannister, or perhaps they caught his scent. Summer began to growl first. Grey Wind picked it up. They padded toward the little man, one from the right and one from the left.

"The wolves do not like your smell, Lannister”, Theon Greyjoy commented.

“Perhaps it’s time I took my leave”, Tyrion said. He took a step backward..and Shaggydog came out of the shadows behind him, snarling. Lannister recoiled, and Summer lunged at him from the other side. He reeled away, unsteady on his feet, and Grey Wind snapped at his arm, teeth ripping at his sleeve and tearing loose a scrap of cloth.

“No!” Bran shouted from the high seat as Lannister’s Men reached out for their steel. “Summer, here. Summer to me! Rickon, call him,” Bran shouted to his baby brother, and Rickon remembered himself and screamed, “Home, Shaggy, home now.” The black wolf gave Lannister one final snarl and bounded off to Rickon, who hugged him tightly around the neck. Lannister undid his scarf, mopped at his brow, and said in a flat voice, “how interesting”. “Are you well my Lord?” Asked one of his men, his sword in hand. He glanced nervously at the direwolves as he spoke. “My sleeve is torn and my breeches are unaccountably damp, but nothing was harmed save my dignity.” Even Robb looked shaken. “The wolves… I don’t know why they did that…”

“No doubt they mistook me for dinner.” Lannister bowed and stiffly to Bran.. “I thank you for calling them off, young ser. I promise you, they would have found me quite indigestible. And now I will be leaving truly.” AGOT, Bran IV

It’s really crazy how the wolves didn’t care for Tyrion right when they see him, and even more so that Robb is actually shocked by it..

“As I was saying before we were rudely interrupted,” Tyrion began, “there is a serious flaw in Littlefinger’s fable. Whatever you may believe of me, Lady Stark, I promise you this– I never bet against my family”-AGOT Tyrion IV

Now this one is towards Sansa, Tyrion has some bitterness towards her in Dance.

“Was she your wife? She was very beautiful.”

And false. Sansa, Shae, all my women.. Tysha was the only one who ever loved me, where do whores go? “A lovely girl,” said Tyrion. -ADWD, Tyrion IX

Now in the show i feel like there’s quite a few hints in seasons 5 and 7 that Tyrion could possibly go a litter darker than we think. First one is here.

They are talking about the savior here, and once Tyrion speaks the girl looks up at Tyrion with a mysterious look I still don’t understand. The rest of the hints are in season 7. It starts off with Jon telling Sansa he trusts Tyrion. I think this is the biggest problem here, if there’s anything we have learned from reading the books and watching the show is you can’t really trust anyone. Now I think if this betrayal does happen, I think it will be mainly towards Jon than anyone (which I’ll explain why). As time goes on we can start seeing Tyrion getting annoyed by Jon and his influence over D*ny. It starts with D*ny taking off to go North to help Jon and Jorah. Tyrion tells D*ny they’ll be lost without her if anything happens to her. Then later in the Dragonpit we have Tyrion looking upset and annoyed with Jon as he notices Jon has bent the knee in private to D*ny, and then announces it to Cersei. Just look at Tyrions face here.

Then we have a talk with Cersei and Tyrion (which we still don’t know what was said at the end of this scene).

And finally we get this scene. Tyrion outside of D*ny’s room.

Now I get why some have taken this scene as he made some sort of an agreement with Cersei and will betray D*ny later on. Or he’s just being jealous of this new relationship or whatever. But who I’m more worried for here is Jon. Why? Because it follows with this scene.

I think whatever agreement (if there is one) will have something to do with Sansa. Now why her? Well this could work out in two different ways, one, Tyrion could have made an agreement with Cersei now knowing she’s pregnant and feels guilty for what happened to the children, while still trying to keep D*ny’s position and staying loyal to his Queen. Two, I think Tyrion could find out about Jons betrayal towards D*ny, and figures out where Jons true feelings are, and by that getting Sansa caught up in whatever happens later on if Sansa gets taken. Now I don’t think Tyrion will personally take Sansa south to Cersei or any of that, but I could see Tyrion making a messed up mistake and just thinking about himself and D*ny before the Starks… And later getting Sansa involved with whatever happens because of Jons feelings for her. In the end you know what this actually reminds me of too? Is the OG outline Martin had in store, With Tyrion fighting Jon in the end, and how it ends badly for one of them.
